Opposition leaders called for a "March of One Million", from the Arabic {{lang|ar|ÙØ³ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙÙÙÙÙØ©}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/1BCBED22-E192-4A34-BED1-1C7146436175.htm |title=Ø¨Ø¯Ø¡ Ø§ÙØªØ¬ÙØ¹ ÙÙÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙÙÙÙÙØ©|publisher=Aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2011-03-06}}</ref> ''masÄ«rat milyÅna'')<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/01/31/world/main7301297.shtml |title=Egypt Opposition Plans "March of Millions" |publisher=CBS News |date=2011-01-31 |accessdate=2011-03-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/bilder/kairo206.html |title=Marsch der Millionen: In Kairo marschieren die Massen gegen Mubarak|work=[[Tagesschau (Germany)|Tagesschau]]|trans_title=|language=[[German language|German]] |date= |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> from Cairo's Tahrir Square to the [[Heliopolis Palace|Presidential Palace]] in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] on 1 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2011/01/31/3126194.htm|title=Egypt Protesters Call for Million-Man March|publisher=Abc.net.au|date=|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title='Mega Protest' Planned in Egypt|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=31 January 2011|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/01/20111316148317175.html|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Egyptian security forces fortified Mubarak's presidential palace with coils of [[barbed wire]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2011/0202/1224288768049.html|title=West Has Little To Fear from Arab Populism|author=Staunton, Denis|date=2 February 2011|work=[[The Irish Times]] |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
Opposition leaders called for a "March of One Million", from the Arabic {{lang|ar|ÙØ³ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙÙÙÙÙØ©}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/1BCBED22-E192-4A34-BED1-1C7146436175.htm |title=Ø¨Ø¯Ø¡ Ø§ÙØªØ¬ÙØ¹ ÙÙÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙÙÙÙÙØ©|publisher=Aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2011-03-06}}</ref> ''masÄ«rat milyÅna'')<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/01/31/world/main7301297.shtml |title=Egypt Opposition Plans "March of Millions" |publisher=CBS News |date=2011-01-31 |accessdate=2011-03-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/bilder/kairo206.html |title=Marsch der Millionen: In Kairo marschieren die Massen gegen Mubarak|work=[[Tagesschau (Germany)|Tagesschau]]|trans_title=|language=[[German language|German]] |date= |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> from Cairo's Tahrir Square to the [[Heliopolis Palace|Presidential Palace]] in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] on 1 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2011/01/31/3126194.htm|title=Egypt Protesters Call for Million-Man March|publisher=Abc.net.au|date=|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title='Mega Protest' Planned in Egypt|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=31 January 2011|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/01/20111316148317175.html|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Egyptian security forces fortified Mubarak's presidential palace with coils of [[barbed wire]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2011/0202/1224288768049.html|title=West Has Little To Fear from Arab Populism|author=Staunton, Denis|date=2 February 2011|work=[[The Irish Times]] |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
According to the Egyptian government media, the number of the protesters in Cairo numbered in the thousands. The BBC reported the number of protesters in Tahrir Square ranged from "more than 100,000 to some 250,000âthe square's maximum capacity."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 "Live Update at 15:44: Huge Protests Fan Egypt Unrest"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 1 February 2011.</ref> Egyptian security forces stated that 500,000 people participated in the protests in Cairo alone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/aegyptenprotest120.html |title=Ãgypten: Mubarak verzichtet auf weitere Amtszeit |language={{de icon}} |publisher=tagesschau.de |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> According to ''Al Jazeera'', over one million protesters gathered in central Cairo by the afternoon, a number growing to around 2 million later in the day.<ref>{{Cite news|work=[[Ynetnews]]|last=Shezaf|first=Tsur|title=A Million People Protest in Egypt|date=1 February 2011|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4022504,00.html|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
According to the Egyptian government media, the number of the protesters in Cairo numbered in the thousands. The BBC reported the number of protesters in Tahrir Square ranged from "more than 100,000 to some 250,000âthe square's maximum capacity."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 "Live Update at 15:44: Huge Protests Fan Egypt Unrest"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 1 February 2011.</ref> Egyptian security forces stated that 500,000 people participated in the protests in Cairo alone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/aegyptenprotest120.html |title=Ãgypten: Mubarak verzichtet auf weitere Amtszeit |language={{de icon}} |publisher=tagesschau.de |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> According to ''Al Jazeera'', over one million protesters gathered in central Cairo by the afternoon, a number growing to around 2 million later in the day.<ref>{{Cite news|work=[[Ynetnews]]|last=Shezaf|first=Tsur|title=A Million People Protest in Egypt|date=1 February 2011|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4022504,00.html|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
â
[[File:Cairo protestors in prayer - 1FEB2011.jpg|thumb|left|Demonstrators in Tahrir Square at [[salah|prayer]]]]
 
Similar protests occurred across Egypt with hundreds of thousands in Alexandria, and an estimated 250,000 in Sinai<ref>{{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/20112113115442982.html|title=Protesters Flood Egypt Streets|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=2 February 2011|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/news/blog/2011/feb/01/egypt-protests-live-updates|title=Egypt Protests â Live Updates|work=[[The Guardian]]}}</ref> and [[Suez]]<ref>{{cite web|author=Aneja, Atul|url=http://www.hindu.com/2011/02/02/stories/2011020263100100.htm |title=Unprecedented Show of People Power at Egypt's Tahrir Square |work=[[The Hindu]] |date=2 February 2011|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> marking the largest mobilisation in the then eight day old protest. Meanwhile, a virtual "March of Millions" was launched on [[Facebook]] with the goal of reaching one million voices in support of the march.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=126197157451259|title=Niet Compatibele Browser|publisher=[[Facebook]]|date=|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
Similar protests occurred across Egypt with hundreds of thousands in Alexandria, and an estimated 250,000 in Sinai<ref>{{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/20112113115442982.html|title=Protesters Flood Egypt Streets|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=2 February 2011|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/news/blog/2011/feb/01/egypt-protests-live-updates|title=Egypt Protests â Live Updates|work=[[The Guardian]]}}</ref> and [[Suez]]<ref>{{cite web|author=Aneja, Atul|url=http://www.hindu.com/2011/02/02/stories/2011020263100100.htm |title=Unprecedented Show of People Power at Egypt's Tahrir Square |work=[[The Hindu]] |date=2 February 2011|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> marking the largest mobilisation in the then eight day old protest. Meanwhile, a virtual "March of Millions" was launched on [[Facebook]] with the goal of reaching one million voices in support of the march.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=126197157451259|title=Niet Compatibele Browser|publisher=[[Facebook]]|date=|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
